shorts.title: GAMEFACE: LFC Capsules for Week 3
shorts.description: WYOMING VALLEY WEST (0-2) AT 1-NORTH POCONO (2-0) When: Friday, 7 p.m. Where: North Pocono Trojans Stadium Last: North Pocono, 23-7 (2024) The buzz: North Pocono won two of the three meetings in the series. North Pocono is off to a good start and withstood a challenge from Pittston Area in a 34-21 win last week. Wyoming Valley West lost to LFC Division I member Scranton, 45-7, last week. WVW RB Malique Campbell ran for 75 yards and a touchdown against the Knights. WILKES-BARRE AREA (1-1) AT 2-VALLEY VIEW (2-0) When: Friday, 7 p.m. Where: John Henzes/Veterans Memorial Stadium Last: […]

WVW RB Malique Campbell ran for 75 yards and a touchdown against the Knights. WILKES-BARRE AREA (1-1) AT 2-VALLEY VIEW (2-0) When: Friday, 7 p.m. Where: John Henzes/Veterans Memorial Stadium Last: […]

shorts.title: GAMEFACE: LFC Players to Watch in Week 3
shorts.title_distilled: GAMEFACE: LFC Players to Watch in Week 3.
shorts.description: JAYDEN TAYLOR North Pocono, RB Came off the bench to provide a spark with 107 yards on 20 carries in North Pocono’s 34-21 win over Pittston Area. He had 160 yards rushing this season. CALEB BROWN Valley View, QB In his second start, he completed seven of 17 passes for 61 yards in a 24-13 win over Crestwood. The sophomore has completed 13 of 25 passes for 142 yards and a TD this season. COLIN OWENS Lackawanna Trail, OL-LB He had a strong game on both sides of the ball against Western Wayne. He helped the Lions run for 315 […]

shorts.title: Carbondale’s Columbia Hose Company 5 installs officers
shorts.title_distilled: Carbondale’s Columbia Hose Company 5 installs officers.
shorts.description: Installation of officers was held for the Columbia Hose Company 5 in Carbondale, the oldest volunteer fire company in Lackawanna County, founded June 6, 1856. Mayor Michele Bannon administered the oath for the year 2025. From left: Lt. Jeff Martin; Joseph Moran, treasurer; Dianne Grasso, secretary; James Kelly, president; Bannon; Kevin Colgan, captain; Fred Moase, vice president; and Harry Smith, trustee.
shorts.content: Installation of officers was held for the Columbia Hose Company 5 in Carbondale, the oldest volunteer fire company in Lackawanna County, founded June 6, 1856. Mayor Michele Bannon administered the oath for the year 2025. From left: Lt. Jeff Martin; Joseph Moran, treasurer; Dianne Grasso, secretary; James Kelly, president; Bannon; Kevin Colgan, captain; Fred Moase, vice president; and Harry Smith, trustee.
shorts.content_distilled: Installation of officers was held for the Columbia Hose Company 5 in Carbondale, the oldest volunteer fire company in Lackawanna County, founded June 6, 1856.

shorts.title: GAMEFACE: Game of the Week, 9-Lakeland at 3-Riverside
shorts.title_distilled: GAMEFACE: Game of the Week, 9-Lakeland at 3-Riverside.
shorts.description: Riverside had high expectations entering the season and knew two of its greatest challenges would come in the first three weeks. The Vikings earned an overtime win over rival Dunmore in Week 1, and then they held off a comeback from Hanover Area. On Friday, No. 3 Riverside (2-0) will host No. 9 Lakeland (2-0) at 7 p.m. at Veterans Memorial Stadium in a battle of two teams that are off to good starts and will likely be factors in the District 2 Class 2A playoffs in November. “Things have been good so far,” Riverside quarterback and defensive back Brayden […]
shorts.content: Riverside had high expectations entering the season and knew two of its greatest challenges would come in the first three weeks. The Vikings earned an overtime win over rival Dunmore in Week 1, and then they held off a comeback from Hanover Area. On Friday, No. 3 Riverside (2-0) will host No. 9 Lakeland (2-0) at 7 p.m. at Veterans Memorial Stadium in a battle of two teams that are off to good starts and will likely be factors in the District 2 Class 2A playoffs in November. “Things have been good so far,” Riverside quarterback and defensive back Brayden […]

shorts.title: HS SOCCER: McClintock sparks Wallenpaupack boys to win
shorts.title_distilled: HS SOCCER: McClintock sparks Wallenpaupack boys to win.
shorts.description: Colin McClintock had a goal and an assist in the second half to help Wallenpauack complete a 3-0 victory over Valley View in a Lackawanna League Division I boys soccer match Thursday at John Henzes Veterans Memorial Stadium in Peckville. Colby Bonagura and Robert Kratzer also scored for the Buckhorns. Josh Katz had three saves to notch the shutout. FIRST: Bonagura, 14:02; SECOND: Kratzer from McClintock, 41:52. McClintock, penalty kick, 79:34; Shots-corners: WAL 13-5, VV 7-4; Saves: Katz (WAL) 3, Kopa (VV) 9. Scranton Prep 4, Scranton 1: At Scranton, Landen Cannon and Juma Sylvain each scored two goals to […]
